title: Ejercicios: Asignación de Activos y Diversificación

items.prompt: If we _______ our portfolio last year, we would have avoided the tech crash.
items.explanation: This is a Third Conditional (If + Past Perfect, would have + past participle) referring to a hypothetical past situation.

items.prompt: By the end of the decade, we _______ our exposure to emerging markets significantly.
items.explanation: The Future Perfect (will have + past participle) is used for actions that will be completed by a specific point in the future.

items.prompt: We recommend _______ in a mix of stocks and bonds to manage risk.
items.explanation: The verb 'recommend' is followed by a gerund when there is no direct object.

items.prompt: If you _______ more capital, would you invest in alternative assets?
items.explanation: This is a Second Conditional (If + Past Simple, would + verb) for hypothetical present/future situations.

items.prompt: Our goal is _______ the highest possible return for this risk level.
items.explanation: The infinitive 'to achieve' is used after 'be' to express an aim or purpose.

items.prompt: By next month, the fund _______ all its underperforming assets.
items.explanation: Future Perfect for a completed action by a future time ('by next month').

items.prompt: If the market _______ so volatile, we wouldn't have sold our shares.
items.explanation: Third Conditional: 'hadn't been' is the past perfect for the hypothetical past condition.

items.prompt: Investors often fail _______ the long-term benefits of diversification.
items.explanation: The verb 'fail' is followed by an infinitive.

items.prompt: If we _______ more in commodities, our portfolio would be more balanced now.
items.explanation: Mixed conditional: Had + Past Perfect (past condition) and would + verb (present result).

items.prompt: The manager decided _______ the asset allocation strategy.
items.explanation: The verb 'decide' is followed by an infinitive.

items.prompt: By the time the report is published, we _______ our quarterly targets.
items.explanation: Future Perfect for completion by a certain time.

items.prompt: If central banks _______ interest rates earlier, inflation would be lower today.
items.explanation: Mixed conditional (Past action, present result).

items.prompt: It is worth _______ the correlation between different asset classes.
items.explanation: The expression 'it is worth' is followed by a gerund.

items.prompt: If you _______ the risk, you would have chosen a different strategy.
items.explanation: Third conditional for a past situation.

items.prompt: By 2030, many investors _______ to ESG-compliant portfolios.
items.explanation: Future Perfect.

items.prompt: The client avoided _______ in high-yield bonds due to the risk.
items.explanation: The verb 'avoid' is followed by a gerund.

items.prompt: If the company _______ more cash, they would acquire their rival.
items.explanation: Second conditional for a hypothetical present.

items.prompt: We aim _______ a balanced portfolio within six months.
items.explanation: The verb 'aim' is followed by an infinitive.

items.prompt: By next Friday, I _______ the risk analysis for all departments.
items.explanation: Future Perfect.

items.prompt: If the audit _______ any fraud, the CEO would have resigned.
items.explanation: Third conditional.

items.prompt: Diversification involves _______ your investments across different sectors.
items.explanation: The verb 'involve' is followed by a gerund.

items.prompt: If you _______ me earlier, I would have changed the allocation.
items.explanation: Third conditional.

items.prompt: By the end of the meeting, we _______ a decision on the new assets.
items.explanation: Future Perfect.

items.prompt: The company expects _______ its revenue by 15% this year.
items.explanation: The verb 'expect' is followed by an infinitive.

items.prompt: If the stock market _______, many investors would lose their savings.
items.explanation: Second conditional.

items.prompt: I don't mind _______ the financial statements once more.
items.explanation: The verb 'mind' is followed by a gerund.

items.prompt: If they _______ the warning signs, they could have prevented the loss.
items.explanation: Third conditional.

items.prompt: By tomorrow, we _______ all the necessary legal documents.
items.explanation: Future Perfect.

items.prompt: We plan _______ the portfolio annually to maintain the target weights.
items.explanation: The verb 'plan' is followed by an infinitive.

items.prompt: If the interest rates _______ lower, we would have borrowed more.
items.explanation: Third conditional.

items.prompt: Spending too much time _______ historical data can be misleading.
items.explanation: The phrase 'spend time' is followed by a gerund.

items.prompt: By next month, the bank _______ our credit limit.
items.explanation: Future Perfect.

items.prompt: If you _______ the truth, the situation would be much better now.
items.explanation: Mixed conditional (Past action, present result).

items.prompt: The company promised _______ the shareholders more frequently.
items.explanation: The verb 'promise' is followed by an infinitive.

items.prompt: If the government _______ taxes, the market would react negatively.
items.explanation: Second conditional.

items.prompt: I am looking forward _______ the new investment policy.
items.explanation: The expression 'look forward to' is followed by a gerund.

items.prompt: By the end of the week, they _______ the merger details.
items.explanation: Future Perfect.

items.prompt: If the project _______ a success, we would have expanded globally.
items.explanation: Third conditional.

items.prompt: We suggest _______ the portfolio twice a year.
items.explanation: The verb 'suggest' is followed by a gerund.

items.prompt: If the budget _______ tighter, we wouldn't have hired new staff.
items.explanation: Third conditional.

items.prompt: By next year, we _______ all our debts.
items.explanation: Future Perfect.

items.prompt: The analyst risks _______ wrong if he ignores the trends.
items.explanation: The verb 'risk' is followed by a gerund.

items.prompt: If you _______ more attention to the numbers, you wouldn't be in this mess.
items.explanation: Mixed conditional.

items.prompt: The board agreed _______ the capital expenditure.
items.explanation: The verb 'agree' is followed by an infinitive.

items.prompt: By the end of the day, I _______ the spreadsheet.
items.explanation: Future Perfect.

items.prompt: If the economy _______, we would need to rethink our strategy.
items.explanation: Second conditional.

items.prompt: The manager postponed _______ the decision until Monday.
items.explanation: The verb 'postpone' is followed by a gerund.

items.prompt: If we _______ the contract, we would be in legal trouble now.
items.explanation: Mixed conditional.

items.prompt: By next Friday, the audit _______ finished.
items.explanation: Future Perfect Passive.

items.prompt: It is important _______ the risk-reward ratio.
items.explanation: The infinitive is used after adjectives ('important').
